sen.j: 花子（はなこ、本名：太田ひさ、慶応4年4月15日 (旧暦)（グレゴリオ暦1868年5月7日） - 昭和20年（1945年）4月2日）は、明治から昭和初期にかけてヨーロッパで活躍した日本人女優、ダンサー。
sen.e: Hanako (Real name: Hisa OTA; May 7 1868 to April 2, 1945) was a Japanese actress and dancer who enjoyed a flourishing career in Europe from Meiji period to early Showa period.
Hanako (Real name: Hisa OTA; May 7 1868 to April 2, 1945) was a Japanese actress and dancer who enjoyed a flourishing career in Europe from Meiji period to early Showa period.
Hanako (Real name: Hisa OTA; May 7 1868 to April 2, 1945) was a Japanese actress and dancer who enjoyed a flourishing career in Europe from Meiji period to early Showa period.

sen.j: 1900年代初頭、単身でヨーロッパに渡り舞台女優として活躍し、日本文化の紹介者としての役割を担った。
sen.e: At the beginning of 19002, she left for Europe by herself, performed as an actress, and played a role to introduce Japan.
At the beginning of the 1900s, she left for Europe by herself, performed as an actress, and played a role to introduce Japan.
sen.cmt: ・「1900年代」にtypoがあったため、修正しました。
sen.e: At the beginning of the 1900s, she left for Europe by herself, performed as an actress, and played a role to introduce Japan.

sen.j: また、彫刻家オーギュスト・ロダンに認められ、モデルとなっている。
sen.e: Also, she was recognized by a sculptor, François-Auguste-René Rodin and became a model for his paintings.
Also, she was recognized by a sculptor, François-Auguste-René Rodin and became a model for his sculptures.
sen.cmt: ・ロダンは彫刻家なので、paintingは削除しsculptureに変更しました。
sen.e: Also, she was recognized by a sculptor, François-Auguste-René Rodin and became a model for his sculptures.

sen.j: 森鴎外の短編小説「花子」のモデルである。
sen.e: She is a model of the short novel "Hanako" authored by Ogai MORI.
She is a model of the short novel "Hanako" authored by Ogai MORI.
She is a model of the short novel "Hanako" authored by Ogai MORI.

sen.j: 尾張国中島郡上祖父江村（愛知県尾西市、現一宮市）出身。
sen.e: She was born at Kamisofue Village, Nakashima-gun, Owari Province (Bisai City, Aichi Prefecture, presently Ichinomiya City).
She was born at Kamisofue Village, Nakashima-gun, Owari Province (Bisai City, Aichi Prefecture, presently Ichinomiya City).
She was born at Kamisofue Village, Nakashima-gun, Owari Province (Bisai City, Aichi Prefecture, presently Ichinomiya City).

sen.j: 2歳の時に親元を離れて名古屋市に移り住み、4歳の時に養子に出され、酒井ひさとなる。
sen.e: At the age of 2 she left her parents to live in Nagoya City and at the age of 4 she wa adopted to be named Hisa SAKAI.
At the age of 2, she left her parents to live in Nagoya City and at the age of 4, she was adopted to be named Hisa SAKAI.
sen.cmt: ・at age of …の後にカンマを追加しました。（2カ所）・wasにtypoがあり、修正しました。
sen.e: At the age of 2, she left her parents to live in Nagoya City and at the age of 4, she was adopted to be named Hisa SAKAI.

sen.j: 家の没落の影響もあり、旅芸人一座に入れられる。
sen.e: Partly as a result of the ruin of her family, she was put into a traveling entertainer group.
Partly as a result of the ruin of her family, she was put into a traveling entertainer group.
Partly as a result of the ruin of her family, she was put into a traveling entertainer group.

sen.j: その後、1880年に舞子になり、1884年に芸者となる。
sen.e: After that she became a maiko (apprentice geisha) in 1880 and a geisha (Japanese professional female entertainer at drinking party) in 1898.
After that she became a maiko (apprentice geisha) in 1880 and a geisha (Japanese professional female entertainer at drinking party) in 1884.
sen.cmt: ・1884年にtypoがあったため修正しました。
sen.e: After that she became a maiko (apprentice geisha) in 1880 and a geisha (Japanese professional female entertainer at drinking party) in 1884.

sen.j: 1888年に身請けされ結婚するが、1898年に離婚する。
sen.e: She got miuke(redeem, buy the freedom of a geisha from her employer) in 1888, but divorced in 1898.
She got miuke(redeem or buy the freedom of a geisha from her employer) in 1888, but divorced in 1898.
sen.cmt: ・redeemは動詞なので、その後にorを入れてbuy以下と並列としました。
sen.e: She got miuke(redeem or buy the freedom of a geisha from her employer) in 1888, but divorced in 1898.

sen.j: 同年再婚するが1901年に離婚する。
sen.e: In the same year she remarried, but in 1901 she divorced.
In the same year, she remarried, but in 1901 she divorced.
sen.cmt: ・文頭にin the same yearがあるため、その後にカンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In the same year, she remarried, but in 1901 she divorced.

sen.j: 1902年、旅芝居の一座としてデンマークコペンハーゲンへ渡る。
sen.e: In 1902 she left for Copenhagen, Denmark as amember of a traveling entertainer group.
In 1902 she left for Copenhagen, Denmark as a member of a traveling entertainer group.
sen.cmt: ・a とmemberとの間にスペースを入れました。
sen.e: In 1902 she left for Copenhagen, Denmark as a member of a traveling entertainer group.

sen.j: 「武士道」「ハラキリ」といった、侍物の舞台を演じたという。
sen.e: It is said that she played the stages of Samurai mono such as 'Bushido' and 'Harakiri'.
It is said that she played the stages of Samurai mono such as 'Bushido' and 'Harakiri'.
It is said that she played the stages of Samurai mono such as 'Bushido' and 'Harakiri'.

sen.j: 当時の東洋ブームに乗り、ヨーロッパ各地で巡業する。
sen.e: Taking advantage of the Oriental boom at that time, she toured various places in Europe.
Taking advantage of the Oriental boom at that time, she toured various places in Europe.
Taking advantage of the Oriental boom at that time, she toured various places in Europe.

sen.j: 1905年、イギリスロンドンでロイ・フラー（1900年のパリ万国博覧会 (1900年)で川上貞奴と川上音二郎を出演させ、日本ブームを巻き起こした女性プロデューサー）に見出され、花子一座を旗揚げし、看板女優となる。
sen.e: She was discovered by Loie Fuller (a female producer who had Sadayakko KAWAKAMI and Otojiro KAWAKAMI perform at the Paris World Exposition in 1900 to cause a Japan boom to take place) and started on Hanako troupe and became a marquee player of it.

She was discovered by Loie Fuller (a female producer who had Sadayakko KAWAKAMI and Otojiro KAWAKAMI perform at the Paris World Exposition in 1900 to cause a Japan boom to take place) and started on Hanako troupe and became its marquee player.
sen.cmt: ・byとLoieの間のスペースを一つ削除しました。・最終行のitsはHanako troupeを指します。
sen.e: She was discovered by Loie Fuller (a female producer who had Sadayakko KAWAKAMI and Otojiro KAWAKAMI perform at the Paris World Exposition in 1900 to cause a Japan boom to take place) and started on Hanako troupe and became its marquee player.

sen.j: このとき芸名を「花子」とする。
sen.e: The stage name was determined to be 'Hanako' then.
The stage name was determined to be 'Hanako' then.
The stage name was determined to be 'Hanako' then.

sen.j: その後数回帰国をしたが、1921年までヨーロッパ、アメリカ合衆国など18ヶ国で巡業を続ける。
sen.e: Since then she returned to Japan several times, but continued touring 18 countries including Europe, USA and so on.
Since then she returned to Japan several times, but continued touring 18 countries including Europe, USA and so on.
Since then she returned to Japan several times, but continued touring 18 countries including Europe, USA and so on.

sen.j: この最中の1906年に再々婚するが、1910年に夫と死別し、本名を太田ひさに戻す。
sen.e: During the tour, she got married for the third time in 1906, but was widowed in 1910 and changed her name back to Hisa OTA.
During the tour, she got married for the third time in 1906, but was widowed in 1910 and changed her name back to Hisa OTA.
During the tour, she got married for the third time in 1906, but was widowed in 1910 and changed her name back to Hisa OTA.

sen.j: 公演された作品は、「左甚五郎の京人形」「芸者の仇討ち」「ハラキリ」などである。
sen.e: The productions which were performed include 'Kyo dolls of Jingoro HIDARI', 'Revenge of Geisha', 'Harakiri' and so on.
The productions which were performed include 'Kyo dolls of Jingoro HIDARI', 'Revenge of Geisha', 'Harakiri' and so on.
The productions which were performed include 'Kyo dolls of Jingoro HIDARI', 'Revenge of Geisha', 'Harakiri' and so on.

sen.j: 劇中の切腹（ハラキリ）の場面での、怨念と悲哀の激しい情念のこもった演技が各地で評価されていたという。
sen.e: The performances with full of flaming pathos of a deep-seated grudge and sorrow in the Harakiri scene and emotions in a drama are said to have been appreciated at various places.
The performances with full of flaming pathos of a deep-seated grudge and sorrow in the Harakiri scene and emotions in a drama are said to have been appreciated at various places.
The performances with full of flaming pathos of a deep-seated grudge and sorrow in the Harakiri scene and emotions in a drama are said to have been appreciated at various places.

sen.j: 1912年ころにはモスクワの演劇学校で演技指導をし、モスクワ芸術座のコンスタンチン・スタニスラフスキーらとと親交があったという。
sen.e: It is said that around 1912 she taught acting at an acting school in Moscow and that she formed friendship with Constantin Stanislavsky et al of Moscow Arts Theatre
It is said that around 1912 she taught acting at an acting school in Moscow and that she formed friendship with Constantin Stanislavsky and others of Moscow Arts Theatre.
sen.cmt: ・et al.は論文の引用文献の著者名に使われることが多く、この文章中では少し堅い印象があるのでand othersに変更しました。・文末にピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: It is said that around 1912 she taught acting at an acting school in Moscow and that she formed friendship with Constantin Stanislavsky and others of Moscow Arts Theatre.

sen.j: 1906年にオーギュスト・ロダンに出会い、彫刻のモデルを頼まれる。
sen.e: In 1906 she met François-Auguste-René Rodin and asked to be the model of sculpture.
In 1906 she met François-Auguste-René Rodin and was asked to be the model of sculpture.
sen.cmt: ・「頼まれる」の英訳が受動態になっていなかったのでbe動詞を追加しました。
sen.e: In 1906 she met François-Auguste-René Rodin and was asked to be the model of sculpture.

sen.j: 以後帰国するまでモデルをつとめた。
sen.e: Since then she served as a model till she returned to Japan.
Since then she served as a model till she returned to Japan.
Since then she served as a model till she returned to Japan.

sen.j: また、ロダン夫妻と寝食を共にするほどの親交があったという。
sen.e: Also it is said that she had such a close friendship as living with Rodin and his wife under the same roof.was
Also it is said that she had such a close friendship with Rodin and his wife as they lived under the same roof.
sen.cmt: ・文章自体が完結していなかったので、trans1を参考にこちらで英訳しました。
sen.e: Also it is said that she had such a close friendship with Rodin and his wife as they lived under the same roof.

sen.j: ロダンが花子をモデルにした作品は約60点。
sen.e: Rodin made some 60 paintings using Hanako as model.
Rodin made some 60 sculptures modeled on Hanako.
sen.cmt: ・ロダンは彫刻家なので、paintingは削除しsculptureに変更しました。・modeled on「～をモデルにしている」という表現を使用しました。
sen.e: Rodin made some 60 sculptures modeled on Hanako.

sen.j: そのうち2点を花子は持ち帰っている。
sen.e: Two of them were brought back by Hanako.
Two of them were brought back by Hanako.
Two of them were brought back by Hanako.

sen.j: 帰国後は岐阜市の妹の元に身を寄せ。
sen.e: After returning to Japan, she stayed with her sister in Gifu City.
After returning to Japan, she stayed with her sister in Gifu City.
After returning to Japan, she stayed with her sister in Gifu City.

sen.j: 1945年に死去する。
sen.e: She died in 1945.
She died in 1945.
She died in 1945.

sen.j: 墓は岐阜市鶯谷町の浄土寺にある。
sen.e: Her tomb exists in Jodo-ji Temple at Uguisudani, Gifu City.
Her tomb exists in Jodo-ji Temple at Uguisudani, Gifu City.
Her tomb exists in Jodo-ji Temple at Uguisudani, Gifu City.

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年） 誕生。
sen.e: She was born in 1868.
She was born in 1868.
She was born in 1868.

sen.j: 1872年（明治5年） 酒井家の養女となる
sen.e: In 1872 she was adopted by Sakai Family.
In 1872 she was adopted by the Sakai family.
sen.cmt: ・「酒井家」の英訳に定冠詞を追加し、familyと変更しました。
sen.e: In 1872 she was adopted by the Sakai family.

sen.j: 1877年（明治10年） 旅芸人一座の子役として各地を巡業
sen.e: In 1877 she toured various places as a child actress of a traveling entertainer group.
In 1877 she toured various places as a child actress of a traveling entertainer group.
In 1877 she toured various places as a child actress of a traveling entertainer group.

sen.j: 1884年（明治17年） 名古屋で芸者になる。
sen.e: In 1884 she became a geisha in Nagoya.
In 1884 she became a geisha in Nagoya.
In 1884 she became a geisha in Nagoya.

sen.j: 1888年（明治21年） 最初の結婚。
sen.e: In 1888 she got married for the first time.
In 1888 she got married for the first time.
In 1888 she got married for the first time.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年） 離婚。
sen.e: In 1898 she divorced.
In 1898 she divorced.
In 1898 she divorced.

sen.j: 再婚。
sen.e: She got re-married.
She got re-married.
She got re-married.

sen.j: 1901年（明治34年） 離婚。
sen.e: In 1901 she divorced.
In 1901 she divorced.
In 1901 she divorced.

sen.j: 1902年（明治35年） コペンハーゲンの動物園の見世物興行の踊り子として、デンマークに渡る。
sen.e: In 1902 she left for Denmark to be a dancer of entertainment shows at the Zoo in Copenhagen, Denmark.
In 1902 she left for Denmark to be a dancer of entertainment shows at the zoo in Copenhagen.
sen.cmt: ・大文字を小文字に直しzooに変更し、二回目に出てくるDenmarkは必要ないと判断し削除しました。
sen.e: In 1902 she left for Denmark to be a dancer of entertainment shows at the zoo in Copenhagen.

sen.j: 1905年までドイツ、トルコ、イギリスなどを巡業。
sen.e: By 1905 she had toured Germany, Turk, England, and so on.
By 1905 she had toured Germany, Turkey, England, and so on.
sen.cmt: ・トルコにtypoがあったので修正しました。
sen.e: By 1905 she had toured Germany, Turkey, England, and so on.

sen.j: 1906年（明治39年） ロンドンでロイ・フラーと出会う。
sen.e: In 1906 she met with Loie Fuller in London.
In 1906 she met Loie Fuller in London.
sen.cmt: ・meet withにすると「約束して会う」という意味になるのでwithを削除しました。
sen.e: In 1906 she met Loie Fuller in London.

sen.j: 花子一座を立ち上げ、看板女優となる。
sen.e: She started on Hanako troupe and became a marquee player of it.
She started on Hanako troupe and became its marquee player.
She started on Hanako troupe and became its marquee player.

sen.j: デンマーク、ノルウェー、スウェーデン、ドイツ、ベルギー、オーストリア、フランスなどを巡業する。
sen.e: She toured Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Germany, Belgium, Austria, France, and so on.
She toured Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Germany, Belgium, Austria, France, and so on.
She toured Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Germany, Belgium, Austria, France, and so on.

sen.j: 1906年（明治39年）7月 ロダンと出会う。
sen.e: In July, 1906 she met Rodin. and asked to be the model of sculpture.
In July, 1906 she met Rodin.
sen.cmt: ・and asked to be the model of sculptureの部分を削除しました。
sen.e: In July, 1906 she met Rodin.

sen.j: モデルを申し込まれる。
sen.e: She was asked to be the model of sculptures.
She was asked to be the model of sculptures.
She was asked to be the model of sculptures.

sen.j: 1906年（明治39年）8月 花子一座を解散。
sen.e: In August,1906 she disbanded Hanako Troupe.
In August,1906 she disbanded Hanako Troupe.
In August,1906 she disbanded Hanako Troupe.

sen.j: 吉川馨と結婚。
sen.e: She married with Kaoru YOSHIKAWA.
She married with Kaoru YOSHIKAWA.
She married with Kaoru YOSHIKAWA.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年） 花子一座を再結成。
sen.e: In 1907 she re-organized Hanako Troupe.
In 1907 she re-organized Hanako Troupe.
In 1907 she re-organized Hanako Troupe.

sen.j: 1909年までに、アメリカ、ドイツ、スイス、ポーランド、ロシア、ブルガリア、オーストリアなどを巡業。
sen.e: By 1909 her troupe had toured America, Germany, Switzerland, Porland, Russia, Bulgaria, Austria, and so on.Bu
By 1909 her troupe had toured America, Germany, Switzerland, Poland, Russia, Bulgaria, Austria, and so on.
sen.cmt: ・RussiaとBulgariaの間のスペースを一つ削除しました。・文尾のBuを削除しました。・Polandのtypoを修正しました。
sen.e: By 1909 her troupe had toured America, Germany, Switzerland, Poland, Russia, Bulgaria, Austria, and so on.

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年） 吉川馨が死去。
sen.e: In 1910 Kaoru YOSHIKAWA died.
In 1910 Kaoru YOSHIKAWA died.
In 1910 Kaoru YOSHIKAWA died.

sen.j: ロダンが花子をモデルにした最初の作品「死の顔」を発表する。
sen.e: Rodin published 'The Face of Dead', his first work that was modeled on Hanako.
Rodin published 'The Face of Dead', his first work that was modeled on Hanako.
Rodin published 'The Face of Dead', his first work that was modeled on Hanako.

sen.j: 森鴎外が短編小説「花子」を発表。
sen.e: Ogai MORI published a short novel 'Hanako'.
Ogai MORI published a short novel 'Hanako'.
Ogai MORI published a short novel 'Hanako'.

sen.j: 1914年（大正3年） 第一次世界大戦勃発。
sen.e: In 1914 the First World War broke out.
In 1914 the First World War broke out.
In 1914 the First World War broke out.

sen.j: ヨーロッパに留まり、慈善興業を行なう。
sen.e: She stayed in Europe andran charity shows.
She stayed in Europe and ran charity shows.
sen.cmt: ・and とranの間にスペースを入れました。
sen.e: She stayed in Europe and ran charity shows.

sen.j: 1916年（大正5年） 戦況の悪化により帰国。
sen.e: In 1916 due to the worsened war situation she returned to Japan.
In 1916, due to the worsened war situation, she returned to Japan.
sen.cmt: ・「戦況の悪化により」にあたる英訳の両側にカンマを入れました。
sen.e: In 1916, due to the worsened war situation, she returned to Japan.

sen.j: 1918年（大正7年） イギリスに渡り、巡業を再開。
sen.e: In 1918 she left for England and resumed her performance tour.
In 1918 she left for England and resumed her performance tour.
In 1918 she left for England and resumed her performance tour.

sen.j: 1921年（大正10年） 帰国。
sen.e: In 1921 she returned to Japan.
In 1921 she returned to Japan.
In 1921 she returned to Japan.

sen.j: 岐阜市の妹の元に身を寄せ、芸妓置屋で暮らす。
sen.e: She stayed with her sister in Gifu City and lived in a geisha dwelling.
She stayed with her sister in Gifu City and lived in a geisha dwelling.
She stayed with her sister in Gifu City and lived in a geisha dwelling.

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年） 高村光太郎が訪れる。
sen.e: In 1927 Kotaro TAKAMURA visited her.
In 1927 Kotaro TAKAMURA visited her.
In 1927 Kotaro TAKAMURA visited her.

sen.j: この頃にロダンの彫刻のモデルをしていた人物として、数多くの芸術家、作家が訪れる。
sen.e: As a person on whom Rodin modeled his sculptures she was visited by many artists and writers.
At that time she was visited by many artists and writers as she used to be a model of Rodin's sculptures.
sen.cmt: ・「この頃」にあたる英訳がなかったので追加し、それに合わせて文章全体も変更しました。・「モデルをしていた」の部分は「かつてモデルをしていた」のニュアンスを出すためused toを使いました。
sen.e: At that time she was visited by many artists and writers as she used to be a model of Rodin's sculptures.

sen.j: 1945年（昭和20年） 丹毒で死去。
sen.e: In 1945 she died of erysipelas.
In 1945 she died of erysipelas.
In 1945 she died of erysipelas.

sen.j: 数多くのロダンとの交流の品が残っていたが、大部分は岐阜空襲で失ったという。
sen.e: There remained a number of things as results of cultural exchanges with Rodin, but most of them were lost in air raids over Gifu.
There had been a number of her belongings that reminded her exchanges with Rodin, but most of them were lost in air raids over Gifu.
sen.cmt: ・「ロダンとの交流の品」の部分は花子の遺品（所有物）belongingsであるため、英訳ではそのように解釈して修正し、それに合わせて文全体も変更しました。
sen.e: There had been a number of her belongings that reminded her exchanges with Rodin, but most of them were lost in air raids over Gifu.

sen.j: 本名は「太田ひさ」であるが、最初に提出された出生届は「太田飛佐」という。
sen.e: Her real name was 'Hisa OTA' (the first name of which was written in hiragana), but the first registration of her birth contained 'Hisa OTA' (the first name of which was written in Kanji).

Her real name was 'OTA Hisa' (the first name of which was written in hiragana, "ひさ"), but the first registration of her birth contained 'OTA Hisa' (the first name of which was written in Kanji, "飛佐").
sen.cmt: ・名前表記の違いについて触れいている内容なので、英訳にも、ひらがな名、漢字名を併記しました。
sen.e: Her real name was 'OTA Hisa' (the first name of which was written in hiragana, "ひさ"), but the first registration of her birth contained 'OTA Hisa' (the first name of which was written in Kanji, "飛佐").

sen.j: また、パスポートの表記は「太田ヒサ」となっている。
sen.e: Furthermore, 'Hisa Ota' (the first name of which was written in katakana) was written on her passport.
Furthermore, 'OTA Hisa' (the first name of which was written in katakana, "ヒサ") was written on her passport.
sen.cmt: ・名前表記の違いについて触れいている内容なので、英訳にも、カタカナ名を併記しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, 'OTA Hisa' (the first name of which was written in katakana, "ヒサ") was written on her passport.

sen.j: また、文献によっては芸名は「太田花子」となっているが、実際には殆ど使われていなかったという。
sen.e: Depending on literature, her stage name was 'Hanako OTA' (the first name of which was written in kanji), but it is said that the stage name was seldom used in reality.
There are some literatures describing her stage name as 'OTA Hanako' or "太田花子", but it is said that the stage name was seldom used in reality.
sen.cmt: ・名前表記の違いについて触れいている内容なので、英訳にも、漢字名を併記しました。・「文献によっては」の部分を「文献のなかには」と解釈し文章を変更しました。・(the first name of which was written in kanji)の部分は原文の内容と合っていないので削除しました。
sen.e: There are some literatures describing her stage name as 'OTA Hanako' or "太田花子", but it is said that the stage name was seldom used in reality.

sen.j: 但し、ロダンとの手紙では「太田ハナ」と表記された物もある。
sen.e: However, 'Hana OTA' whose first name is written in Katakana) was written on some letters exchanged with Rodin.
However, in some letters to Rodin, her name was described as 'OTA Hana' or '太田ハナ' whose first name is written in Katakana.
sen.cmt: ・名前表記の違いについて触れいている内容なので、英訳にも、日本語名を併記しました。・「ロダンとの手紙では…もある」を「ロダンとの手紙のなかには…」と解釈し文章全体を変更しました。
sen.e: However, in some letters to Rodin, her name was described as 'OTA Hana' or '太田ハナ' whose first name is written in Katakana.

sen.j: ロダンは花子を「プチト・ハナコ」と呼び、花子が巡業でない時は自宅で一緒に暮らしていた。
sen.e: Rodin called Hanako 'Petite Hanako' and had her live in his residence when she was not on performance tour.
Rodin called Hanako 'Petite Hanako' and had her live in his residence when she was not on performance tour.
Rodin called Hanako 'Petite Hanako' and had her live in his residence when she was not on performance tour.

sen.j: 「プチト・ハナコ」（小さい花子）の呼び名のとおり、花子は身長が138cmと小柄であった。
sen.e: As expreesed by her common name, 'Petite Hanako' (Small Hanako), she was small, 138 centimeters tall
As expressed by the nickname, 'Petite Hanako' (Small Hanako), she was small, 138 centimeters tall.
sen.cmt: ・common name（通俗名）より愛称という意味の方が適切と思い、変更しました。・文末にピリオドを追加しました。・expressedにtypoがあったので修正しました。
sen.e: As expressed by the nickname, 'Petite Hanako' (Small Hanako), she was small, 138 centimeters tall.

sen.j: 森鴎外は直接には花子との面識はなかった。
sen.e: Ogai MORI was not personally acquainted with Hanako.
Ogai MORI was not personally acquainted with Hanako.
Ogai MORI was not personally acquainted with Hanako.

sen.j: 短編小説「花子」は、ロダンと花子との間を通訳をした人物が森鴎外の息子（森於菟）の家庭教師だったため、その人物から花子の話を聞いて書かれたものである。
sen.e: The short novel, 'Hanako' was written based on what was heard from the person who was an interpreter between Rodin and Hanako and who happened to be the private tutor of Ogai MORI's son (Oto MORI).
The short novel, 'Hanako' was written based on what was heard from the interpreter between Rodin and Hanako, who happened to be the private tutor of Ogai MORI's son (Oto MORI).
sen.cmt: ・person who was anの部分はない方が冗長にならないと判断し削除しました。 ・beと theの間のスペースを削除しました。・whoの後にカンマを付け、非制限用法としました。
sen.e: The short novel, 'Hanako' was written based on what was heard from the interpreter between Rodin and Hanako, who happened to be the private tutor of Ogai MORI's son (Oto MORI).

sen.j: 花子をモデルにした作品は、日本では新潟市美術館（「死の顔・花子」「空想する女・花子」）で見ることができる。
sen.e: The works modeled on Hanako can be seen at Niigata City Museum ('The face of Death, Hanako', and 'Fantasizing Woman, Hanako').
The works modeled on Hanako can be seen at Niigata City Museum ('The face of Death, Hanako', and 'Fantasizing Woman, Hanako').
The works modeled on Hanako can be seen at Niigata City Museum ('The face of Death, Hanako', and 'Fantasizing Woman, Hanako').
